alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 10 at 9:46PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY ALONG THE YUKON RIVER AT EAGLE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...Yukon River at Eagle. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Sunday. * IMPACTS...The Yukon River may rise above the natural riverbank. Ice jam flooding has high uncertainty. Impacts could range between localized high water and severe flooding. Now is the time to take precautions. Where possible, move items to higher ground and prepare your community for possible flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Water levels have risen approximately 7 feet since Monday at Eagle and are continuing to steadily increase at Eagle. The Yukon at Dawson broke up on Tuesday afternoon and a large ice jam formed down river Tuesday evening. This jam was holding on Wednesday, with downstream to approximately 10 miles upriver from the Fortymile confluence. The Yukon River is expected to breakup in Eagle between Thursday afternoon and Sunday. Intact ice is in place in front of Eagle. Breakup above Eagle has been dynamic with ice jams forming and releasing, this is expected to continue down river past Eagle.
info.instruction: You should monitor local river conditions and prepare for the possibility of ice jam flooding. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
